content.title: ICAR Emeritus Scientist
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.beneficiary: Retired scientists of repute from the National Agriculture Research System
content.details: The ICAR Emeritus Scientist Scheme is a structural method of tapping the Brain and skill bank of the outstanding superannuated professionals of NARS by allowing them to complete the work in hand for its fruitful conclusion, utilize their talent in teaching specialized courses and use their experience in addressing nationally important policy issues.
benefits: Emeritus Scientists will be entitled to an honorarium of Rs.50,000/- per month in addition to a pension.
A contingent grant of Rs. 2,00,000/- per annum per scientist.
Grant for engagement of one Junior Research Fellow/Senior Research Fellow/Research Associates.
The Emeritus Scientist will devote his whole time to the project.
The Emeritus Scientist shall not receive any assistance for the same work from any other source.
The Emeritus Scientist shall normally remain attached to an Agricultural University / ICAR Institute.
The Emeritus Scientist will participate in the teaching programmes.
The Emeritus Scientist shall be entitled to residential accommodation.
The appointment shall start only after the Scientist has actually retired.
The Emeritus Scientist will be eligible to avail of one-month leave with honorarium for each completed year of his / her tenure.
The duration of appointment of the Emeritus Scientist shall be strictly three years.
eligibility: The applicant should be an outstanding superannuated teacher/Scientist with a good record of published work and teaching/training experience of a minimum of 5 years.
The ICAR Emeritus Professor can work under this scheme up to the age of 70 years or up to three years, whichever is earlier.
The teacher/Professor who is to retire in the next 12 months time is eligible to apply.
The maximum age limit for applying for ICAR Emeritus Professor will be 65 years.
content.application_process: Online application is required. The eligible scientist/faculty who is to retire in the next 12 months may send 15 copies of the application in the prescribed Proforma to the Deputy Director General (Education), ICAR.
documents_required: 15 copies of the application in the prescribed Proforma.

faqs.question: What is the maximum age to apply for Emeritus Scientist?
What will be the maximum age to work as Emeritus Scientist?

faqs.answer: The eligible scientist/faculty who is to retire in the next 12 months may send 15 copies of the application in the prescribed Proforma.
